attributes.action: Stop charging VAT on gym memberships
attributes.background: stop charging 20% vat on gym membership. The UK is in an obesity epidemic, the nhs is under a huge strain. By removing vat from gym membership, gym owners can reduce their monthly fees, making the gym more affordable, and reinvest into more specialist equipment.
attributes.additional_details: People’s health & weight has become a huge issue in the UK, our health services are struggling to cope. Removing the VAT on gym memberships would allow gym owners to reduce their membership fee, invest into more equipment that will help people with their weight loss & health issues. By encouraging more people to use gyms & fitness centres, will improve there overall health, and reduce the strain inthe already overstretched NHS

attributes.action: Do away with City Mayors and return power to Central Government.
attributes.background: City Mayors are unnecessary,  many of them create far more problems than they solve, and they implement changes that are very difficult to reverse. City mayors are not wanted by the British public.

attributes.action: Ban Ministers from campaigning during referendum campaigns
attributes.background: It is my view that campaigning by Government Ministers during the previous EU referendum was counter-productive. I would like you to create legislation preventing the government and its ministers campaigning for or against a particular outcome during a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: When the UK electorate has a referendum, the decision has been passed to the electorate, the decision does not belong to the Government. It does not make sense for the Government to campaign for or against a particular outcome. They should attempt to remain neutral. Please note that I am referring to the Government and its Ministers, not MP's.

attributes.action: Scrap the NHS' National Child Measurement Programme for children in Year 6
attributes.background: Parents are told their child’s overweight if they're on the 91st centile (14% of Yr 6), but many are healthy. In a vulnerable child, this label can lead to eating disorders and THEN they become unhealthy. The scheme isn't working; child obesity at this age has continued to rise since it began.
attributes.additional_details: This NHS scheme hasn't lowered obesity rates, but much needed funding is spent on this ineffective scheme, as well as support for eating disorders that could have been triggered by it. Schools often feed children unhealthy meals but then weigh them and they are are obese. Eating disorders at this age are highly damaging as they delay puberty; children can't develop and grow, and mental well-being is drastically affected. This happened to me 2 years ago, age 11, when I was deemed 'overweight'.

attributes.action: Review sentencing to ensure it works for single victims of repeated abuse
attributes.background: I want the government to order a review of sentences for abuser. If they commit the same offence towards the same person repeatedly over a period of time, it should be treated much more seriously.
attributes.additional_details: An offender who repeatedly abused children for 10 years was charged with only 11 counts of rape, but the abuse had taken place over 10 years. The amount of time the child has been abused needs to count. The abused child has lost those years. Those 10 years count.

attributes.action: Create a minimum free-to-carry hand luggage allowance for all UK-bound flights.
attributes.background:
Airlines are constantly removing luggage allowances. It started as hold luggage, and now carriers are removing hand luggage allowances too. 

Luggage is an essential part of flying. Being required to pay for it is unfair on the consumers.
attributes.additional_details:
Ryanair has started charging even for hand luggage. It's likely other carriers will follow suit. 

Consumers have no protection from these practices, and ultimately are forced into paying the fees, as a hand luggage allowance is essential to most people when flying. 

The aim of this petition is to encourage the government to make a minimum requirement of free-to-carry hand luggage for flights in/outbound of the UK, so consumers are not forced to pay for every essential thing when flying.

attributes.action: Ensure that there is a Mental Health nurse or doctor in every GP practice
attributes.background:
I feel as if the current system in place in GP surgeries is inadequate for the amount of people that are facing mental health issues in this country.

'At any time, one in six adults has a mental health condition and one in 100 has a severe mental illness.' (Nuffield Trust, 2015)
attributes.additional_details: From personal experience, I feel that you do not get the same level of care with a normal GP, as they are not necessarily trained across the mental health spectrum. They rush the 10 minute appointment because they have 100s of patients to see per day. This needs to change. There needs to be a dedicated member of staff for times of crisis, and for people that maybe need longer appointments to explain their issues.

attributes.action: Fund the provision of support dogs for assault or abuse survivors with PTSD.
attributes.background: The government could fund and support charities to be able to specifically help the availability of these dogs for sexual assault or domestic violence survivors instead the charities allowing only war veterans to obtain a emotional support dog in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Studies have shown that 20 percent of soldiers come home for war with PTSD however they've also shown that out of all sexual assault, rape or domestic violence survivors that 30 percent have PTSD. Studies have also proved that 82 percent of people (in the USA) with an emotional support dog had a reduction in symptoms like anxiety attacks and nightmares than before and 40 percent reported that they reduced their use of medication. The impacts of these dogs is astronomical to someone's daily life.

attributes.action: Intruduce Commercial Dog Walking to be a licensed and inspected profession
attributes.background: Commercial dog walking has become massive in recent years and it would appear that nothing is required to practice. Some do provide excellent service to help our dogs have a better life whilst we are at work etc however there are many who walk no limit of dogs, do not clean up and intimidate others.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst using the South Downs on a regular basis I come across many dog walkers. They walk up to 8 dogs individually & not all on leads. Myself & my dog find when the dogs approach intimidating & quite often do not clear up after the dogs or have control. Something needs to be put in place for the sake of the general public who want to walk their dogs without the worry of feeling intimidated when walking the downs or any public space. Kennels & Boarders are licenced & inspected & must be trained & insured to protect OUR pets.A license should be a requirement to allow Authorities to inspect vehicles used to transport dogs, check on insurance and the walkers experience. Numbers walked commercially must also be limited.

attributes.action: Anyone caught using a knife to attack someone gets a minimum of 5 years inside
attributes.background: Something has to be done regarding soring knife crime

attributes.action: Improve treatment and support for patients with small cell lung cancer
attributes.background: Small cell lung cancer is an underfunded type of cancer in the UK. It takes many lives due to its aggressive nature of metastasising rapidly. I want the government to consider improving treatment options and support to improve life expectancy for patients with this condition.

attributes.action: Ban the use of farrowing crates for pigs
attributes.background: I know that sadly the last petition on the issue ended without receiving a debate. Pigs have high cognitive intelligence that has been proven to be higher than that of cats and dogs - it is cruel enough to put them through the pain of death and unwanted pregnancy, but a farrowing crate is torture.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.seeker.com/iq-tests-suggest-pigs-are-smart-as-dogs-chimps-1769934406.html
For those who do not know, a farrowing carts is a metal cage where pigs spend 5 weeks unable to turn around during the pain of pregnancy and a few weeks thereafter. Many pigs go through this process a number of times in their life so are unable to access their young or nurture them properly.
https://lib.dr.iastate.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1102&context=ans_pubs

attributes.action: Force companies to pay SIA licensed security officers 40% above the minimum wage
attributes.background: Security Officers over the UK are seriously underpaid, and they take huge risks in the job they are doing because of the growing crime rate and the violence within the UK. This petition would look at setting a standard for licensed SIA officer to be paid 40 percent above the minimal wage

attributes.action: Ban Wild Animal Trophy’s entry into the UK
attributes.background: Ban Trophy Hunters bringing their murdered animals heads and skins into the UK. These creatures are being ‘hunted’ in ‘the wild’ for pleasure with considerable cruelty. The animals have no chance as the ‘hunts’ are set up by the land owners pruely for profit and the satisfaction of the most cruel.
attributes.additional_details:
A lion suffered incredible cruelty for at least 10 hours, severely wounded and slowly dying.
Clearly, although the wound was severe, the arrow had missed the vital organs or arteries that would have caused rapid blood loss and a relatively quick death.
Certainly, the lion was so incapacitated that in all those hours he'd been able to move only 350 meters from the place where he was shot.
Judging from the events described the injured lion most likely was killed 10/12 hours after being wounded.

attributes.action: Review personal independence payment screening for Chronic “invisible” illness
attributes.background: Chronic illness such as Crohn’s disease is on a rapid incline and many people are suffering and left unable to work and support themselves and are living on the edge of homelessness day in day out and It would appear that the DWP wish to completely overlook or dismiss such illnesses as we can walk.
attributes.additional_details:
The questions involved are completely irrelevant to illnesses where you can be seen to be able bodied. but illnesses such as Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis as well as many others are being completely overlooked due to reasons such as “you can prepare a meal”, “You can shower and clean yourself.” “You can walk 100 meters” but these factors don’t mean that we can hold down a full time job and in some cases even part time. But more often than not we need support and assistance.

The Government should review whether the PIP process is treating people with invisible illnesses fairly and ensure assessors and questions are suitable.

attributes.action: Make it legal for horses to be ridden on pavements and walkways-safer all round!
attributes.background: Accidents involving horses cause serious injury. There are no clear guidelines for drivers in the highway code.  Most are not aware of horse behaviour and how to pass safely. For everyone's benefit, horses and riders are safer on pavements.

attributes.action: Fund more nurses and training for trauma wards in hospitals.
attributes.background: I spent 27 days on trauma ward in hospital. I saw and experienced call bells being ignored, 'red tray' patients not fed as not enough staff and long waits for painkillers. The Government should provide more funding for trauma nurses and better training for staff who work on trauma wards.
attributes.additional_details: Patients (including myself) were left on bed pans/commodes/equipment way longer than necessary and going into emotional breakdown, lashing out at staff. Patients were being referred to as bed numbers. Curtains (for privacy) were being drawn so carelessly that half the ward, including visitors, could see the person using bedpan/having intimate care done. Quiet patients were being ignored and forgotten over demanding ones.

attributes.action: Seek agreement to extend Article 50 period by one year to achieve best possible
attributes.background: With the government in crisis and running out of time to negotiate a Brexit deal, article 50 must be extended. If the U.K. is to get a good deal, we will need more time. Therefore, Article 50 must be extended to March 29th, 2020 or we risk a catastrophe.

attributes.action: Zero Hour contracts should be abolished.
attributes.background:
Zero hours contracts should be abolished to stop exploitation of the work force. They do not offer regular working hours and lead to poor working practices. 
It is time Government legislated to outlaw them.

attributes.action: Pass a law to have compulsory clear and concise labelling on ALL food and meds
attributes.background:
Allergies cause deaths and allergic reactions cost the NHS every time someone has to go to A&E.
There is currently a nationwide Adrenalin pen shortage making this cause even more urgent.
ALL Food, toiletries and medications need clear concise labelling for all major allergens.
attributes.additional_details: Anaphylactic shock is terrifying and can result in death. Anyone living with an allergy knows the fear of eating, something that should be sustenance suddenly becomes a deadly game of Russian Roulette. A simple labelling system for all consumables that is industry standard with regard to all ingredients and packaging environments will save lives and remove fear and make providers accountable to do their due diligence as to how their product is produced and ingredients sourced.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for the cosmetic industry to state allergens on product
attributes.background: I recently was hospitlised after an allergic reaction to a moisturiser containing peanut oil. This was not clearly visible on the website or bottle. I want to make it a legal requirement for the cosmetic industry to make this clear (emboldened, capitalised) on their products to avoid this happening.
attributes.additional_details: This currently isn’t a legal requirement that companies need to state on products. With the increasing number of nut allergy’s reported each year as well as the number of deaths I think this is extremely important to raise awareness. The NHS reported 4000 new nut allergy’s in 2005 and the number of the diagnosis’ rise each year. It is crucial that more visibility is present in the beauty industry. Some companies name the nuts as clinical terms, making it harder for the sufferer to be aware.

attributes.action: Make charging extortionate amounts for the equivalent gluten free items illegal
attributes.background: Gluten free items are typically at least double or triple the cost of standard items which is essentially exploitation against those genetically susceptible and intolerant/reactive to gluten. Is this not indirect discrimination, treating this population differently? This has been so hard for me.
attributes.additional_details:
A gluten free lifestyle can be tough enough without having to pay extortionate amounts for food and for small amounts. Its been difficult to switch to a gluten free diet not just physically and mentally but also financially. This should not be the case. 
Severe abdominal pain, fatigue, indigestion, bloating, vomiting and anaemia are just a few of the symptoms you can experience by eating gluten with such conditions like Celiac and IBS. Now, thousands of people are affected. We can help them.

attributes.action: Make all schools become 'plastic free' (single use plastic) by 2021.
attributes.background: We teach our students about how to help the environment, but schools still produce huge amounts of plastic waste. We need to lead by example and show the younger generation that we can actually do something about it.

attributes.action: Bring science class size restrictions in England/Wales in line with Scotland/NI.
attributes.background: The importance of practical work in STEM subjects is at the forefront of the new GCSE and A-level reforms, but regrettably this is not currently supported by legislation to limit class sizes to 20, as is the case in Scotland/NI. In England and Wales science is not counted as a 'practical' subject.
attributes.additional_details:
Regulations do exist in Scotland, where no practical class
(including science) may exceed 20 pupils [Schools
Code, 1956]. Similarly, in Northern Ireland, Regulation 15 of
the Secondary Schools Regulations
(Northern Ireland) 1973 No 403 requires that practical class
sizes shall not exceed 20 where the pupils are under
instruction by one teacher. 
However, this only applies to technology classes in England and Wales, not science classes. Students do not get a fair deal from this inequality.

attributes.action: Remove the housing element part of Universal Credit and put back housing benefit
attributes.background: We must act immediately to take the housing element of Universal Credit and put it back to the totally seperate housing benefit! Many British people are now becoming homeless or are at risk of becoming homeless due to not physically being able to work or being mentally capable og holding down a job.
attributes.additional_details: This is a serious issue that MUST be addressed immediately! Many lives are being put at risk as sanctions and benefit non payments are stopping people keeping a roof over the heads of themselves and their families! The cost of living, rent, council tax, and travel has raised so much now that a person going to a minimum wage job can nolonger even pay their bills and rent let alone get to work and feed their whole families. We need housing benefit back, we cannot let homelessness become forced!

attributes.action: Remove the use of 'British Empire' in the UK honours system.
attributes.background:
This petition aims to remove the use of 'British Empire' in UK honorary titles, ending the continuation of colonial language. 

E.g. 'Member of The British Empire' (MBE)
E.g. 'Officer of The British Empire (CBE)

Such awards should be reformed, finally bringing these titles into the modern age.

attributes.action: Refer to disability as a “different ability” on official publications and in law
attributes.background: I do not believe that all “disabilities” put people at a disadvantage as implied by the term dis-ability. I believe this reference drives a thinking and culture that is not inclusive and supportive of many peoples varying abilities. I believe all references should refer to different abilities.
attributes.additional_details:
I was diagnosed with a form of learning “disability” in high school. From my perspective this ability has never been a detriment to me in fact in many ways it has been a strength as I learn very visually and so I am able to create simple views of complex information. 
 
However the cultural reference of a disability drives a lack of acceptance within the work place and society. 
 
Do you have a different ability and would like it recognised as such?
 
Small words have big affects.

attributes.action: I want the government to allow yearly smear tests for all women.
attributes.background: Women in the UK are told to wait every 3 years for a smear test and it is too long. In the past 5 years, I have had two abnormal smear tests and I have paid to go privately every year because I am too scared to wait 3 years. Two other members of my family have had the same issue. We need change!

attributes.action: Make political education compulsory in secondary schools.
attributes.background: In our politics class we have been debating the crisis of participation and the democratic deficit. We feel that a lack of political participation is caused partly by a lack of political education - so people don't understand how important it is to make their voice heard through voting.

attributes.action: Plant more trees in national parks and local communities!
attributes.background:
By using land that is free from agriculture and future urban expansion to plant trees, we can help Britain lead in combating climate change!

Working with farmers to utilise their free space for more trees, increasing forestland in national parks and working with local councils to help plant trees
attributes.additional_details:
This project would create jobs as well as working with existing companies, could utilise the younger generation into it by offering part time/full time work, or volunteering programmes.

This would help Britain send a message to the rest of the world in one solution for combating climate change. This would be a great investment for our country in so many ways, both short term and long term. 

Let's make Britain green!

attributes.action: Allow parliamentary time for a Bill for democratic reform of the House of Lords
attributes.background: Between 2001 and 2015 successive parliaments failed to agree on Bills to complete the work of the 1999 House of Lords Act by creating a democratic elected Second Chamber. In the last parliament a House of Lords Reform Bill passed its Second Reading in the Lords but was given no further time.
attributes.additional_details: An elected Second Chamber was first discussed in the 1911 Parliament Act, and again in the 1999 House of Lords Act. In 2015 all the major parties promised Lords reform in their election manifestos, but only a Private Members Bill was brought forward. That Bill was a compromise proposal aimed at finding the consensus which had eluded the attempts of the previous Coalition and Labour Governments. That consensus can only be found if sufficient time is allowed for debate.

attributes.action: Don’t scrap the 1p or 2p coin
attributes.background: Recently there have been calls for the 1p and 2p coin to be scrapped. I believe that this would have a huge effect of the UK public, This would mean any tax increases would jump to a minimum of 5p, that has an effect on petrol prices, shop prices would increase, leaving the British public worse off.
attributes.additional_details: Supermarkets etc would increase prices by 5p per item when they do increase a price, for eg, Mr & Mrs Public go shopping to their local supermarket, the store has had a store wide increase on tinned goods, so the couple buy 20 tins of varied products, all of which have had an increase of 5p, thats an extra £1 on that shop alone, £52 a year rise in costs, that’s just on one example of shopping, let alone the other rises, to jump from a 1p rise to a 5p rise is too much for a lot of people.

attributes.action: a maximum amount to be specified for school uniforms
attributes.background: School uniforms are now ridiculously expensive and even primarily schools are now setting excessive rules on school uniforms.  Parents are effectively paying hundreds of pounds in “fees” just to send a child to school.  Parents should not have pay for these excessive uniforms
attributes.additional_details: Schools should be ordered to set a maximum amount of £50 for the whole uniform and any costs in excess of this must be bourne by the school.  This would also prevent schools from selecting one supplier who can then dictate the price people pay.  As education is mandatory parents should not be forced into paying excessive amounts just to send a child to school

attributes.action: The cost of a colour TV licence should be cut to £100.
attributes.background:
BBC news and current affairs programmes are no longer of high quality.
In an age of austerity where ordinary people are struggling to make ends meet, a licence fee of £150 is no longer justified for substandard broadcasting.
attributes.additional_details:
As a national broadcaster, the BBC is expected to be fearless, objective and impartial in its reporting of news and current affairs programming.
The BBC often avoids or downplays politically sensitive news items, allows statements to go unchallenged and uses false equivalence to counter balance expert opinion.
These are not the attributes expected of a national broadcaster in a leading democratic nation.

attributes.action: Ban the use of straws and plastic packaging in the UK
attributes.background: Plastic is polluting the ocean. Marine species then eat it causing plastic toxins to be absorbed into their body and enter the food chain. The plastic in their environment can also hurt the animals.

attributes.action: Mandatory right for substance misuse clients to have an independent advocate
attributes.background: We want it to be a statutory right for people with substance misuse issues to have access to an independent advocate, like other types of patients in the Mental Health Act 2010. We feel this will allow dual diagnosis clients who can't access mental health services better access to support networks.
attributes.additional_details:
50% of people with severe mental health issues have substance misuse issues.
37% of alcohol abusers have a mental health issue.
53% of drug users also have mental health issues.
These people cant access independent advocates through the mental health act because mental health services want these people to deal with their addictions before they commence treatment for mental health.

Figures from Helpguide.org

attributes.action: Leave the EU with no deal, free trade with the commonwealth
attributes.background: The British people voted to leave the EU not stay in the EU in every practical sense. Morals come above money, if our economy is slightly hurt it is worth the price of self rule, freedom and pride. We should build strong trade bonds with the common wealth but no free movement of people.

attributes.action: Bring back the death penalty for child murderers, rapists and paedophiles.
attributes.background: The death penalty should be brought back for people who abuse and murder young babies and children or who rape babies and young children. There is no cure for pure evil or pedophillia and almost everyone who gets convicted of any of these crime almost always certainly go on to do the same again.

attributes.action: Remove bylaw that means boat owners get prosecuted and fined as well as skippers
attributes.background: The IFCA’s that patrol and enforce out  to 6 mile waters have introduced a new bylaw that means if a skipper is prosecuted for an offence that the owners of the boat automatically get convicted and fined if the skipper is found guilty. This is an injustice to the boat owners.
attributes.additional_details: This is just a money making exercise for them and not in the best interest of the fishing industry. We need to stop this now

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all UK social workers to wear body cameras
attributes.background: Service users have made allegations with no way of proving if a worker is treating them unfairly. It should be a legal requirement for social workers to wear body cameras to establish if this is the case.
attributes.additional_details: There have been cases in the headlines of children wrongfully removing from their families. There are Facebook groups of parents desperately trying to get their children home, usually without success. There are news articles and court hearings that have exposed mis-information, unfortunately children may have already been traumatised after being removed from their home, resulting in mental health issues, attachments issues and a ruined childhood.

attributes.action: life in prison for those that cause death through drink driving
attributes.background: As a biker I know of far too many lives affected throughbdrink driving

attributes.action: Change the current process when bringing complaints to the IOPC
attributes.background: The IOPC (formerly the IPCC) is responsible for overseeing complaints made against police forces in England and Wales. However, the current procedure allows Chief Constables to circumnavigate the IOPC and investigate complaints themselves. We want this changed to make the IOPC truly independent.
attributes.additional_details: When a complaint is made to the IOPC the current procedure is that it is sent to the Chief Constable of the force being complained about. It is then the decision of that Chief Constable whether he/she will investigate or hand it back to the IOPC. This current system is not independent or fair and means that in many cases the complainant is prevented by the police from being heard by anyone impartial unless they apply for a Judicial Review afterwards, which is beyond the financial means of most.

attributes.action: Ban e-cigarettes from open display in shops and treat them like tobacco.
attributes.background: E-cigarettes are very popular with teenagers who become addicted to nicotine and turn eventually to tobacco. They should be treated in the same way as tobacco and placed out of view in shops and petrol stations otherwise we will see an epidemic of e-cigarette use, like America, here in our schools.
attributes.additional_details: "E-cigarettes are 75% to as harmful as tobacco" (Stanton Glantz, Professor of Medicine and Tobacco Control, UCSF, 2018). PHE is ignoring the evidence in its claims they are 95% safer! In the US, the FDA is now clamping down hard on the e-cigarette industry (which is mostly the Big Tobacco!) because of the rising epidemic of vaping in high schools. Vaping creates nicotine addiction and teenagers are 4-6 times more likely to try tobacco! Vaping is conditioning us to accept smoking as normal again.

attributes.action:
Stop medicine wastage
Give our unused medicines to developing countries in need
attributes.background:
Tons of unused medicines are returned to pharmacies every year.  These medicines are incinerated rather than re-issued.

Meanwhile developing countries are rife with counterfeit medicines.

Giving our unused unopened medicines to developing countries would relieve sufferring and harm.
attributes.additional_details:
When a medicine is returned to a pharmacy in the UK for whatever reason, we assume that it can't be re-used.  This is not so.  

Medicine wastage in the UK costs the NHS around £300 million with £110 million of pharmaceuticals returned unopened & unused to pharmacies every year.  Instead of re-issuing these medicines they are incinerated.

These drugs should be given to developing countries across the world in the fight against  counterfeit medicines which are rife and are causing actual harm.

attributes.action: Make new commercial buildings have solar panels unless good reason can be given
attributes.background: The roofs of commercial buildings could provide clean, cheap electricity to the grid. Frequently this space is not used for this purpose. Unless there are good reasons not to fit them, such as not fitting in with the local environment or bring prohibitevly expensive, they should be fitted.

attributes.action: Request for help and assist for serious flood situation Kerala, India,
attributes.background: This petition on behalf of Malayalies in UK and their families and friends in Kerala included among the 35 Million, the southern state of India. Death toll is rising every hour, every minute. More than 250,000 people have fled their homes.The aged, young, ill and pregnant are stranded.
attributes.additional_details:
All the shutters of 36 of the 39 reservoirs have been open and it was continuously and heavily raining for the past one week.

We beg for mercy in front of the whole world, we need help

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-45216671

https://www.facebook.com/johnygeorge.kalathiparambil/videos/1830622453700580/UzpfSTEwMDAwNTE3MDcxNDIwNDoxMDY3Nzk3ODk2NzM1ODkx/
https://news.sky.com/world
https://edition.cnn.com/2018/08/17/asia/kerala-flood-death-rise-intl/index.html

attributes.action: Ban all forms of gambling advertisements like the banning of tobacco commercials
attributes.background: The government is not doing enough to support people that are suffering from the severity of gambling addiction. Through numerous means, gambling organisations are targeting and taking advantage of  vulnerable gambling addicts by bombarding them with the temptation to give in to their impulses.
attributes.additional_details:
For the serious addict- a slogan that says 'When the Fun Stops, Stop' on the bottom of gambling adverts is not enough to rid any real impulse. The addict that is actively working on their recovery can find a single advert on the internet or TV extremely triggering.

The government has a responsibility to protect it's citizens in the face of corporations that are tactically taking advantage of addicts, particularly where gambling is readily available with a few taps on our mobile devices.

attributes.action: Make Escort Vehicles Carry Highways Agency Code Of Practice Mandatory.
attributes.background:
I would like the Highways Agency Code of Practice for Escort Vehicles markings and lighting made mandatory.
I am increasingly observing so called Escort Vehicles without adequate safety warning markings front or rear including width of vehicle lighting.
I doubt they are fully insured or equipped.
attributes.additional_details:
What I am describing does not make a good Escort Operator but does bring a more safety conscious driver to the mind of the motoring public therefore safety becomes more paramount. If you like, wearing a uniform describes our profession at a glance. 
There are many of us who adhere to this practice including the equipment we should be carrying for emergency or breakdown and can be found on social media where we share some experiences.

attributes.action: Mandatory invisible disability signs to be displayed in highly populated areas
attributes.background: my son is 5 yrs old, non verbal autistic, who's behaviour can be hard and unpredictable at times, especially on public transport where we have had to explain his behaviour and rude comments made about him. physical disabilities don't have to be explained so why should invisible ones?
attributes.additional_details:
hidden and mental disabilities should be recognised equal to those with physical disabilities. no one should have to justify their actions because of their disability. signs should be put in restaurants, on public transport, in schools and play parks etc and any other public places with large volumes of people ...
stop people thinking children with additional needs are naughty by raising awareness.

attributes.action: Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges while on duty.
attributes.background:
Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges.

Lights and/or siren not required to be active for exemption.

Only requirement is for staff to be on duty (on call) but not restricted to being on a call and is to include brake times.
attributes.additional_details: www.express.co.uk/news/uk/993969/parking-warden-ticket-paramedics-north-west-ambulance-service/amp
